page.title: 18Grampound Rd Cricket Club
page.content: The Cricket Club play about 70 to 80 matches a year. They play on Saturdays and sometimes on Sundays. They play touring sides midweek. Sometimes other teams play against visiting sides on the field. They practice on Tuesdays and Fridays. Sometimes they have to travel 40 miles to get to matches. Grampound Rd. Cricket Club play in all kinds of competitions. They play an evening knock-out, and Evening League, a Whitbread National Village Competition and an Eastern County League event. The pavilion came from St. Austell. It is used for changing, preparing and eating teas. They discuss matches at the bar. They have meetings to select teams. The changing rooms have showers. The Cricket Club has 2 teams, lst and 2nd, and players of all ages take part.
